channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kurdish group PKK declares ceasefire with Turkey
item.description: The PKK calls for the release of its jailed leader Abdullah Ocalan to lead a process of disarmament.

item.title: Trump signs executive order making English the official language of the U.S.
item.description: In the nearly 250-year history of the United States, English had never been designated as the nation's official language.

item.title: How to watch the Oscars and who is nominated
item.description: Who will win, what can we expect and what has caused the most controversy this awards season?

item.title: In the US, DEI is under attack. But under a different name, it might live on
item.description: Donald Trump has promised to "terminate" diversity programmes. But a rebrand might yet save them.

item.title: Up to 3,000 more U.S. troops are ordered to the border with Mexico
item.description: Up to 3,000 additional troops have been ordered to the U.S.-Mexico border by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, the latest in President Trump's efforts t...

item.title: Israel approves extension of Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Israel proposes a six-week truce covering Muslim Ramadan and Jewish Passover - but Hamas has not yet commented.

item.title: Grammy-nominated R&B singer Angie Stone dies in car crash
They weren’t considered fully human when they died. Now they’re being reburied with equal rights
Attorneys are suing to keep 10 migrants out of Guantanamo Bay as others say they were abused there
item.description: Civil rights attorneys are suing the Trump administration to prevent it from transferring 10 migrants detained in the U.S. to Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

item.title: Legendary former NIH director retires from embattled agency
item.description: Dr. Francis Collins is leaving the National Institutes of Health, where he served as director from 2009 to 2021. The agency is facing cutbacks and res...

item.title: Kurdish militant group PKK declares ceasefire after decades of conflict with Turkey
item.description: Militants from the Kurdistan Workers' Party have declared a ceasefire, in what may represent a significant political breakthrough for Turkish Presiden...

item.title: FedEx plane makes emergency landing at Newark after bird strike, engine fire
item.description: A FedEx cargo plane made an emergency landing at Newark Liberty International Airport after a bird strike caused an engine fire, the FAA says.

item.title: Trump advisers recall what led up to Oval Office confrontation
item.description: The president's closest advisers, stunned after the debacle in the Oval Office, huddled on Saturday morning were still uncertain how to salvage a mini...

item.title: Illinois' hidden, frozen waterfalls draw adventure-seekers
item.description: Frozen and hidden waterfalls less than two hours from Chicago are attracting people with a passion for winter and adventure. Noel Brennan has more.

item.title: Judge rules that Trump's firing of whistleblower office chief was unlawful
item.description: Hampton Dellinger, who leads the Office of Special Counsel, sued President Trump last month after he was fired.

item.title: 'They don't belong in the Med': Future of homeless orcas still uncertain
item.description: Animal rights campaigners and marine zoo official say Mediterranean is 'too warm' for killer whales.

item.title: Taking a ride on a freight train to cover migration to the U.S.
item.description: For decades, migrants have been riding north through Mexico aboard a freight train nicknamed "La Bestia." An NPR reporter hopped on board to ask some ...

item.title: Andrew Cuomo running for mayor of NYC
item.description: Andrew Cuomo announced Saturday afternoon that he would run for mayor of New York City, joining a crowded race.
